title: 'Honest' photo showing Nutella's separated ingredients is putting people off chocolate spread
text:
'Honest' photo of Nutella's separated ingredients is putting people off the chocolate spread It certainly doesn't look as appetising as the gooey chocolate goodness we're used to Share Nutella is the most popular chocolate hazelnut spread around (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Nutella has had a hard time of it recently. 
Following reports that one of its most crucial ingredients, palm oil, can cause cancer, many will be reconsidering tucking into a jar of their favourite chocolate spread. 
The product's makers, Ferrero, hit back at the claims and stressed that Nutella is safe . 
But now there's a new photograph doing the rounds which is putting people off all over again. 
Someone has decided to wash out a Nutella jar and make a sort of 'deconstucted' chocolate spread, refilling the pot with its ingredients. 
It claims to be all in proportion, which is why some people have been utterly shocked by the amount of sugar in it which, in the photograph, looks to be about a third. 
One person commented: "That bottom half is what concerns me. So much sugar in so many things." 
But Nutella is actually made up of more than 50% sugar - higher than it looks to be on the image. 
The official website lists the sugar content as 56.8g per 100g serving, or 56.8%. 
Other ingredients include skimmed milk powder, hazelnuts, cocoa powder and the controversial palm oil. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
